entry.et: Middle English praty, prety, from Old English prættig tricky, from prætt trick; akin to Old Norse prettr trick

def.dt: :artful clever
:pat apt
:pleasing by delicacy or grace
:having conventionally accepted elements of beauty
:appearing or sounding pleasant or nice but lacking strength, force, manliness, purpose, or intensity pretty words that make no sense Elizabeth B. Browning
:miserable terrible a pretty mess you've gotten us into
:stout
:moderately large :considerable a very pretty profit cost a pretty penny
:easy to enjoy :pleasant usually used in negative constructions reality is not so pretty Caleb Solomon

entry.pr: ˈpri-tē, ˈpər- also ˈpru̇-; before “near(ly)” often ˈpərt or ˈprit or ˈpru̇t

def.dt: :in some degree :moderately pretty cold weather
:quite mainly the wound was…pretty bad Walt Whitman
:in a gracefully pleasing manner :prettily pop vocalists who can sing pretty Gerald Levitch
:mainly largely

entry.pt: Some handbooks complain that pretty is overworked and recommend the selection of a more specific word or restrict pretty to informal or colloquial contexts. Pretty is used to tone down a statement and is in wide use across the whole spectrum of English. It is common in informal speech and writing but is neither rare nor wrong in serious discourse he may, if he be pretty well off or clever, qualify himself as a doctor G. B. Shaw a return to those traditions of American foreign policy which worked pretty well for over a century H. S. Commager the arguments for buying expensive books have to be pretty cogent Times Literary Supplement

def.dt: :dainty clothes
:lingerie
:a pretty person or thing
:to make pretty usually used with up curtains to pretty up the room
:a man who is notably good-looking
:dandy 1

entry.et: Middle English sitten, from Old English sittan; akin to Old High German sizzen to sit, Latin sedēre, Greek hezesthai to sit, hedra seat

def.dt: :to rest on the buttocks or haunches sit in a chair often used with down
:perch roost
:to occupy a place as a member of an official body sit in Congress
:to hold a session :be in session for official business
:to cover eggs for hatching :brood
:to take a position for having one's portrait painted or for being photographed
:to serve as a model
:to have one's dwelling place :dwell
:to lie or hang relative to a wearer the collar sits awkwardly
:to affect one with or as if with weight the food sat heavily on his stomach
:lie rest a kettle sitting on the stove
:to have a location the house sits well back from the road
:to blow from a certain direction
:to remain inactive or quiescent the car sits in the garage
:to take an examination
:babysit
:to please or agree with one used with with and an adverb the decision did not sit well with me
:to cause to be seated :place on or in a seat often used with down
:to sit on (eggs)
:to keep one's seat on sit a horse
:to provide seats or seating room for
:to hold deliberations concerning
:repress squelch
:to delay action or decision concerning
:to wait or be ready for (a specific pitch) in baseball
:to withhold applause :fail to show approval or enthusiasm
:to fail to take expected or appropriate action
:to be in a highly favorable situation
:to maintain one's position without change
:to remain quiet in or as if in hiding
:to attend religious service under the instruction or ministrations of
:to attend the classes or lectures of
